content:
ProjectInstance Class

Definition

Represents a project instance.

In this Article

[System.Diagnostics.DebuggerDisplay("{FullPath} #Targets={TargetsCount} DefaultTargets={(DefaultTargets == null) ? System.String.Empty : System.String.Join(";", DefaultTargets.ToArray())} ToolsVersion={Toolset.ToolsVersion} InitialTargets={(InitialTargets == null) ? System.String.Empty : System.String.Join(";", InitialTargets.ToArray())} #GlobalProperties={globalProperties.Count} #Properties={properties.Count} #ItemTypes={items.ItemTypes.Count} #Items={items.Count}")]
public class ProjectInstance
Inheritance
System.Object
ProjectInstance

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

Instances of this class result when a project is cloned. Constructors are internal in order to require users to create project instances from existing projects.

New project instances are immutable, except that instance items can be added to them and instance properties set on them. Project instances are useful because they can be modified and built several times without disturbing the original project.

Neither this class nor any of its constituents is allowed to have references to Microsoft.Build.Construction or Microsoft.Build.Evaluation objects.

Project instance targets, host services, and the task registry are not exposed.

Constructors

ProjectInstance(ProjectRootElement)

Creates a new project instance and initializes it from the given project root, using the default project collection.

public ProjectInstance (Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectRootElement xml);
xml
ProjectRootElement

The project root element.

Remarks

No intermediate Project object is created. This is useful if a project is going to be built, but not displayed or edited.

Creates a new project instance and initializes it from the given project file, using the default project collection.

public ProjectInstance (string projectFile);
projectFile
String

The name of the project file.

Remarks

No intermediate Project object is created. This is useful if a project is going to be built, but not displayed or edited.

Creates a new project instance and initializes it from the given project file, using the given global properties, tools version, and the default project collection.

Remarks

No intermediate Project object is created. This is useful if a project is going to be built, but not displayed or edited.

ProjectInstance(String,IDictionary<String,String>,String,String,ProjectCollection)

Creates a new project instance and initializes it from the given project file, using the given global properties, tools version, sub toolset version, and project collection.

public ProjectInstance (string projectFile, System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<string,string> globalProperties, string toolsVersion, string subToolsetVersion, Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectCollection projectCollection);

String

The name of the project file.

globalProperties
IDictionary<String,String>

The global properties to use. May be null.

toolsVersion
String

The tools version. May be null.

subToolsetVersion

The sub toolset version. May be null.

projectCollection
ProjectCollection

Project collection.

Remarks

No intermediate Project object is created. This is useful if a project is going to be built, but not displayed or edited.

Properties

DefaultTargets

Gets or sets the list of default targets for this project.

public System.Collections.Generic.List<string> DefaultTargets { get; }
Value
List<String>

Returns the list of default targets for this project.

Remarks

Default targets are built if no targets are explicitly specified.

Directory

Gets the project root directory. Used for evaluation of relative paths and setting the current directory during build. Is never null: projects not loaded from disk use the current directory from the time the build started.

public string Directory { get; }
Value
String

Returns the project root directory, which is never null. Projects not loaded from disk return the current directory at the time the build was started.

FullPath

Gets the full path to the project file. Used for logging.

public string FullPath { get; }
Value
String

Returns the full path to the project file. Returns null if the project was never named.

GlobalProperties

Gets the dictionary of global properties this project was evaluated with, if any.

public System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<string,string> GlobalProperties { get; }
Value
IDictionary<String,String>

Returns the dictionary of global properties this project was evaluated with.

Remarks

Read only collection.

Traverses project references.

This is the publicly exposed getter, that translates into a read-only dead IDictionary<string, string>.

InitialTargets

Gets the list of initial targets for the project and all its imports, depth-first. These targets are built before any other targets.

public System.Collections.Generic.List<string> InitialTargets { get; }
Value
List<String>

Returns the list of initial targets for the project and all its imports, depth-first.

IsImmutable

Gets a flag indicating that the project instance is immutable. This flag is set permanently when the instance is created.

public bool IsImmutable { get; }
Value
Boolean

Returns the flag.

ItemDefinitions

Gets a read-only dictionary of the item definitions in the project, keyed by item type.

public System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<string,Microsoft.Build.Execution.ProjectItemDefinitionInstance> ItemDefinitions { get; }
Value
IDictionary<String,ProjectItemDefinitionInstance>

Returns a read-only dictionary of the item definitions in the project, keyed by item type.

Items

Gets all items in this project.

public System.Collections.Generic.ICollection<Microsoft.Build.Execution.ProjectItemInstance> Items { get; }
Value
ICollection<ProjectItemInstance>

Returns all items in this project.

ItemTypes

Gets all item types in this project.

public System.Collections.Generic.ICollection<string> ItemTypes { get; }
Value
ICollection<String>

Returns all item types in this project.

ProjectFileLocation

Gets the location of the originating file itself. Never null.

public Microsoft.Build.Construction.ElementLocation ProjectFileLocation { get; }
Value
ElementLocation

Returns the location of the originating file. Never returns null.

Properties

Gets all properties in this project.

public System.Collections.Generic.ICollection<Microsoft.Build.Execution.ProjectPropertyInstance> Properties { get; }
Value
ICollection<ProjectPropertyInstance>

Returns all properties in this project.

Targets

Gets an enumerator over all targets in this project. This collection is read-only.

public System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<string,Microsoft.Build.Execution.ProjectTargetInstance> Targets { get; }
Value
IDictionary<String,ProjectTargetInstance>

Returns an enumerator over all targets in this project.

ToolsVersion

Gets the tools version this project was evaluated with, if any.

public string ToolsVersion { get; }
Value
String

Returns the tools version this project was evaluated with, if any.

Remarks

The result is not necessarily the same as the tools version on the Project tag, if any; it may have been externally specified, for example with a /tv switch.

Methods

AddItem(String,String)

Adds an item with no metadata to the project.

public Microsoft.Build.Execution.ProjectItemInstance AddItem (string itemType, string evaluatedInclude);
itemType
String

The item type of the item to be added.

evaluatedInclude
String

The evaluated Include attribute of the item.

Returns
ProjectItemInstance

Returns the new item.

Remarks

We don't take a ProjectItemInstance to make sure we don't have one that's already in use by another ProjectInstance.

Adds an item with the given metadata to the project.

String

The item type of the item to be added.

evaluatedInclude
String

The evaluated Include attribute of the item.

metadata
IEnumerable<KeyValuePair<String,String>>

The metadata of the item.

Returns
ProjectItemInstance

Return the new item.

Remarks

We don't take a ProjectItemInstance to make sure we don't have one that's already in use by another ProjectInstance.

Build()

Builds the default targets of the project with loggers of the project collection.

public bool Build ();
Returns
Boolean

Returns true if the build succeeds; false otherwise.

Builds the default targets of the project with the given loggers.

IEnumerable<ILogger>

The loggers to use for the build. May be null.

Returns
Boolean

Returns true if the build succeeds; false otherwise.

Remarks

Throws InvalidOperationException if any of the loggers supplied are already attached to the logging service.

DeepCopy()

Creates an independent, deep clone of this project and everything in it. Clone has the same mutability as the original. Useful for compiling a single file or for keeping build results between builds.

public Microsoft.Build.Execution.ProjectInstance DeepCopy ();
Returns
ProjectInstance

Creates an independent, deep clone of this project.

DeepCopy(Boolean)

Creates an independent, deep clone of this project and everything in it, with specified mutability. Useful for compiling a single file or for keeping build results between builds.

public Microsoft.Build.Execution.ProjectInstance DeepCopy (bool isImmutable);
isImmutable
Boolean

Flag indicating clone mutability.

Returns
ProjectInstance

Returns an independent, deep clone of this project, with specified mutability.

EvaluateCondition(String)

Evaluates the provided string as a condition by expanding items and properties, using the current items and properties available, then doing a logical evaluation.

public bool EvaluateCondition (string condition);
condition
String

The string to be expanded.

Returns
Boolean

Returns true if the string evaluates to true; false otherwise.

Remarks

This is useful for the immediate window.

Does not expand bare metadata expressions.

ExpandString(String)

Evaluates the provided string by expanding items and properties, using the current items and properties available.

public string ExpandString (string unexpandedValue);
unexpandedValue
String

The string to be expanded.

Returns
String

Returns the expanded string value.

Remarks

This is useful for some hosts, or for the debugger immediate window.

Does not expand bare metadata expressions.

Returns the evaluated, escaped value of the Include attribute of the provided item.

String

The item type of the items to be retrieved.

Returns
ICollection<ProjectItemInstance>

Returns all the items in this project of the specified type. Returns an empty list if there are none.

GetItemsByItemTypeAndEvaluatedInclude(String,String)

Gets all the items in this project of the specified type and evaluated include value. This is a read-only list.

public System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<Microsoft.Build.Execution.ProjectItemInstance> GetItemsByItemTypeAndEvaluatedInclude (string itemType, string evaluatedInclude);

String

The item type of the items to be retrieved.

evaluatedInclude
String

The evaluated include value of the items to be retrieved

Returns
IEnumerable<ProjectItemInstance>

Returns all the items in this project of the specified type and evaluated include value. Returns an empty collection if there are none.

Gets the escaped value of the provided metadatum.

The metadatum to be escaped.

Returns the escaped value of the provided metadatum.

The item definition to provide the metadatum value.

String

The name of the metadatum.

String

ProjectItemInstance

The item to provide the metadatum value.

name
String

The name of the metadatum.

Returns
String

Returns the escaped value of the metadatum with the provided name on the provided item.

GetProperty(String)

Get the property with the given name.

public Microsoft.Build.Execution.ProjectPropertyInstance GetProperty (string name);
name
String

The name of the property to retrieve.

Returns
ProjectPropertyInstance

Returns the property with the given name. Returns null if no property exists with that name.

GetPropertyValue(String)

Get the value of the property with the given name.

public string GetPropertyValue (string name);
name
String

The name of the property whose value is to be retrieved.

Returns
String

Returns the value of the property with the given name. Returns an empty string if no property exists with that name. The value returned has no escaped character sequences.

Remarks

This method does not distinguish between a property with a value of empty string and no property with the given name.

GetPropertyValueEscaped(ProjectPropertyInstance)

Get the escaped value of the provided property.

public static string GetPropertyValueEscaped (Microsoft.Build.Execution.ProjectPropertyInstance property);
property
ProjectPropertyInstance

The property to be escaped.

Returns
String

Returns the escaped value of the provided property.

RemoveItem(ProjectItemInstance)

Removes an item from the project, if present. Returns true if it was present, false otherwise.

public bool RemoveItem (Microsoft.Build.Execution.ProjectItemInstance item);
item
ProjectItemInstance

The item to be removed.

Returns
Boolean

Returns true if the item was present before removal; false otherwise.

RemoveProperty(String)

Removes a property with the given name. Returns true if the property had a value (possibly empty string), otherwise false.

public bool RemoveProperty (string name);
name
String

The name of the property to be removed.

Returns
Boolean

Returns true if the property had a value (possibly an empty string) before removal; false otherwise.

SetProperty(String,String)

Add a property with the specified name and value to the project. Overwrites any property with the same name already in the property collection.

public Microsoft.Build.Execution.ProjectPropertyInstance SetProperty (string name, string evaluatedValue);
name
String

The name of the property to add.

evaluatedValue
String

The evaluated value of the property to add.

Returns
ProjectPropertyInstance

Returns the new property.

Remarks

We don't take a ProjectPropertyInstance to make sure we don't have one that's already in use by another ProjectPropertyInstance.

ToProjectRootElement()

Creates a ProjectRootElement from the contents of this ProjectInstance.

public Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectRootElement ToProjectRootElement ();
Returns
ProjectRootElement

Returns a ProjectRootElement which represents this instance.

UpdateStateFrom(ProjectInstance)

Replaces the project state crosoft.Build.Execution.ProjectInstance.GlobalProperties*, crosoft.Build.Execution.ProjectInstance.Properties* and crosoft.Build.Execution.ProjectInstance.Items* with those from the specified ProjectInstance.

public void UpdateStateFrom (Microsoft.Build.Execution.ProjectInstance projectState);
projectState
ProjectInstance

The ProjectInstance to update from.
